newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Taiwan's CPC buys 500,000 barrels Oct reformate.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan's CPC buys 500,000 barrels Oct reformate.

text.p: Taiwan's state-owned Chinese Petroleum Corp (CPC) has bought through a tender 500,000 barrels of unleaded 95-octane reformate for October 16-30 delivery at close to $24.00 per barrel, an official said on Wednesday.
"The price was not so good when we have been used to buying at around $22.00," said the official. "The tender just closed at a wrong time."
The tender, which closed on September 3, sought one cargo of 250,000 barrels on a cost-and-freight (c-and-f) basis to Keelung or Taichung.
Gasoline prices in Singapore jumped 50 cents to $23.50 per barrel on Gulf tensions.
CPC's last tender for unleaded reformate was awarded at $22.20 for September 18-27 delivery and $22.30 for October 5-15.
